Pre-Game Insights: India's recent performance showcases a team with many flaws in the defensive department and an attacking department that failed to find the back of the net in recent games.
Kuwait's performance has been inconsistent recently, securing wins against Bahrain, Syria, and Afghanistan, yet facing bitter defeats, especially in key World Cup qualifier matches.
India's squad presents a mix of seasoned players and emerging talents.
Kuwait's coach, Rui Bento, enjoys the advantage of a full-strength squad.
Historically, India and Kuwait have had several encounters, with India generally having the upper hand.
India has shaken the net eight times, meanwhile, Kuwait has also managed to score 8 in their games against the Blue Tigers.
India’s recent victory in the SAFF Championship final in 2023 against Kuwait gives them a slight upper hand at least from the mentality point of view.
Post-Match Reflections: Fans are eager for an unforgettable display from the Indian team, culminating in a deserving homage to their exceptional captain.
Kuwait is set on disrupting the celebrations and clinching a win to bolster their confidence for upcoming games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is expected to be an exhilarating display of passion, skill, and intensity.
IFTWC predicts a 1-0 win for the Blue Tigers.
The FIFA World Cup 2026 qualifier match between India and Kuwait will telecast live on the Sports18 Network and will also be streamed live on Jio Cinema.
Others: Sunil Chhetri’s final appearance in the national jersey for India is a significant moment for the team and the player.
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu will be in goal for India, while Sulaiman Abdulghafoor will be the goalkeeper for Kuwait.
Sunil Chhetri has become the face of Indian football and an inspiration to numerous young talents over the years.
Press Release: The match is a celebration of a legacy left by a player who has dedicated everything to Indian football.
The match is a chance for India to end their slump and get their first win in 2024.
Interviews: Sunil Chhetri will be leading the team for one final time, lending an emotional edge to the game.
Rui Bento, Kuwait's coach, will be looking to disrupt the celebrations and clinch a win for his team.
